Sentencas: Polarization resistance of solid oxide fuel cell electrodes consists of resistances due to mass transfer and chemical reaction.
Titulo: Magnetic Alignment of Anode Microstructure in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Therefore, higher ion conductivity, electron conductivity, and gas diffusivity and larger triple-phase boundary (TPB) density lead to lower polarization resistance.
Titulo: Magnetic Alignment of Anode Microstructure in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: To increase effective conductivities and diffusivity, tortuosity factors in each mass-transfer path should be reduced.
Titulo: Magnetic Alignment of Anode Microstructure in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: In this study, magnetic alignment method is developed to align the mass-transfer paths in the electrode microstructure.
Titulo: Magnetic Alignment of Anode Microstructure in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Since Ni as an electron-conducting material in anode has high magnetic permeability, the particles are polarized and aligned by a magnetic field.
Titulo: Magnetic Alignment of Anode Microstructure in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Therefore, the tortuosity factors can be reduced.

Sentencas: In addition, this Ni alignment is expected to reduce the tortuosity factors of yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) and pore phases as well.

Sentencas: However, there is a risk for a decrease in TPB density.

Sentencas: The effect of magnetic field on resultant microstructure and polarization resistance of Ni-YSZ anode are investigated by impedance measurement of anode symmetrical cells and by reconstruction of three-dimensional microstructure.

Sentencas: The tortuosity factors of Ni and YSZ decreased and TPB density decreased by the magnetic field.
